name: SRAM XG-1275 12-speed Cassette for GX Eagle

name: Shimano Ultegra CS-R8101-12 12-Speed Cassette
description: The Shimano Ultegra CS-R8101 12-speed Cassette - extensive compatibility and efficient shifting The CS-R8101-12 is a 12-speed cassette from the Shimano road bike series. In contrast to the CS-R8100, it is compatible with both electronic and mechanical groupsets. It features Hyperglide+ technology, which was first tested in the MTB sector and ensures seamless shifting even under heavy load. Even when you are riding out of the saddle or sprinting, you can shift safely and immediately. The gradations have been selected to ensure high gear efficiency in all situations as well as optimal acceleration. The enlarged teeth of the pinions also contribute to this. A special plus point is its compatibility: CS-R8101 not only fits on the special 12-speed freehub body, but can also be used with conventional Shimano road freehub bodies. All sprockets are made of steel, with two lightweight aluminium sprocket carriers. These are shifting aids and specially shaped sprocket teeth that make shifting to larger or smaller sprockets suppler, smoother and quieter. The system of small rivets attached to the side of the sprocket and milled or pressed-in ramps ensures that the chain is already carried along by the next sprocket during the shifting process before it leaves the previous sprocket. Hyperglide+ is optimised for faster shifting and shifting under load and has a more efficient chain connection, holding power and power transfer when combined with a compatible HG chain. Compared to Hyperglide, the shifting time is reduced by one third and the pedal stroke is noticeably reduced. HG+ enables a completely new chain stability and thus offers a safe riding experience. name: Gates Universal Transmission Eco Tension Tester

description: The Universal Transmissions Eco Tension Tester is a low cost tester with separate ruler for measuring and checking the tension of Gates belts. Correct belt tension is essential for optimum functioning of the belt drive so that the belt neither skips nor runs too heavily, thus avoiding increased wear. Common tension adjustment systems include inclined or vertical dropouts, horizontally sliding dropouts (not recommended by Gates) and eccentric bottom brackets. Specifications: Function: Measures belt tension Type: gauge, special tool Compatibility: Gates Carbon Drive System Instructions: Hang the measuring rod on the belt and place the ruler on both sprockets. Check the tension: red means increase the tension, yellow means decrease the tension, green means the tension is OK. During tension adjustment, you must maintain the correct alignment of the belt. Turn the crank a quarter turn and measure again. Repeat the measurement with subsequent crank rotation several times, as the tension level can be different at different points on the belt. Tension recommendations for Gates Carbon Drive are as follows: Off-road and urban - soft and even pedalling style: 40-60 Hz (35-45 lbs) Off-road and urban - strong and hard pedalling style: 60-75 Hz (45-53 lbs) Internally geared hubs: 35-50 Hz (28-40 lbs) Tandem: 60-65 Hz (45-48 lbs) Shimano STEPS: 35-45 Hz (28-35 lbs) Manufacturer Number: S8200061 Contents: Gates Universal Transmissions Eco Tension Tester, consisting of: 1 x measuring device 1 x ruler
